From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Lesa McMahon-Lowe
Sent: Saturday, May 20, 2006 3:12 PM
To: RCU Yahoo Group; UB List
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] I need to VENT!


argh.... I just had a conversation with our 4H leader about something I
wrote on my blog.... I've been censored! the parents of these kids
obviously read the blog and were hurt... though I suppose there may have
been some truth behind what I said for it to bring such defensiveness.
anyhow... some of you already read the post but here it is again... I am
just pissed off right now and need some feedback. http://lifeacademy
homeschooljournal.net/2006/04/21/fear-of-the-homosexual/
~*~*~
Lesa
LIFE Academy
http://lifeacademy.homeschooljournal.net
http://qtpiecraftsandthings.etsy.com

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

~*~*~
Lesa
LIFE Academy <<<

**Awe, I knew you weren't directing it at me. :o) It's too bad about that 4-H
leader being so blinded and stifled by her own thoughts and words. I'd find
another place to spend my time. ****

~Nancy

sore thumb :) Lesa <<

***Soooo you're saying that you might be considered *different* *weird*
*strange* at times in your neck of the woods? :o) awe, too bad you're not
closer
to my neck of the woods then! <g>

Just from reading your other posts in the past, I really didn't consider you

one that would stereotype, I meant no harm to you. :o)
I read what you wrote in your blog and your email about the 4-H leader being

angry............
I still don't get what your 4-H leader was so upset about.***

~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: I need to VENT!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Do you feel this way in your own church as well?  If so there are some open-minded Christian churches.  The UCC church for one and the Unity church.  There
messages.messageBody:
On 5/20/06, Lesa McMahon-Lowe <lesajm@...> wrote:
>
> i though so too... but it's caused some issues in our 4H group. maybe i
> need to find another 4H group.
>
> Lesa
> **who is an outsider not only among other homeschoolers but also among
> most
> other Christians**


Do you feel this way in your own church as well? If so there are some
open-minded Christian churches. The UCC church for one and the Unity
church. There are also quite a few UU churches that are very Christian
leaning in their worship, but liberal in other ways. I know my mom (an
ordained Episcopal priest) has been quite uneasy in her own denomination as
of late.





--
Michelle
Independent Kitchen Consultant #413652
The Pampered Chef
850-474-0817
http://www.pamperedchef.biz/michellelr
Ask me how you can save 60% on some of our most favorite products!

messages.msgSnippet:
thanks Joanne... thank goodness for my RU groups!  I just wish I had a local
RU friend... I live in Central IL and it s so mainstream here... not just
with
messages.messageBody:
thanks Joanne... thank goodness for my RU groups! I just wish I had a local
RU friend... I live in Central IL and it's so mainstream here... not just
with homeschooling but with everything. it can get so frustrating and lonely


not trying to be a downer... thank you (Moderators) for keeping this group
going... because loneliness is a real issue with unschooling sometimes.

~*~*~
Lesa
LIFE Academy
http://lifeacademy.homeschooljournal.net
http://qtpiecraftsandthings.etsy.com
